supporting_spans: M. Noirtier, stretching himself out at his ease in the chair. “Really, pray tell me all about it, for it must be interesting.”
“Well, then, in return for your story,” continued Noirtier, “I will tell you another.”
contradicting_spans: M. Noirtier had once made a will against you—against your family—in favor of the poor, in fact; M. Noirtier is spared, because nothing is expected from him.
reasoning: Evidence supports: The character of Noirtier is described as having a passion for liberty and equality, which aligns with the claim that he devoured Voltaire and Rousseau.

analysis.claim_text: Growing up in Paris he devoured Voltaire and Rousseau, burning with enthusiasm for liberty and equality.

sub_claims.text: Growing up in Paris he devoured Voltaire and Rousseau, burning with enthusiasm for liberty and equality.
He was exposed to the ideas of Voltaire and Rousseau at a young age in Paris.
He had a strong interest in liberty and equality as a result of his exposure to these ideas.

analysis.reasoning: Evidence supports: The character of Noirtier is described as having a passion for liberty and equality, which aligns with the claim that he devoured Voltaire and Rousseau.
